sub: JavaScript apps (with a little backend muscle, much UX/design love... & a bottle of hotsauce just in case)

featured.headline: Things I've built in the recent past:

projects.name: Flashcarderator
status: Ask to sit down for a look
projects.what: ReactJS app that prints 2-sided flashcards, useful for cramming new vocabulary & syntax
projects.roles: Learning Style, A Desire to Flux, Parallax & Print Magic
memories: Reminiscing back to French 101 and how we'd effectively learn new vocabulary with simple old-fashioned flashcards
Thinking flashcards might also ease the transition to ES6+ and other new tech syntax
Preparing for a trip to Lithuania and needing a few basic survival words
Coming up with a solution that accomplished all this, while learning a bit of Flux

projects.name: Vocabulator
status: Ask to sit down for a look
projects.what: Vanilla JS app that splits a text into phrases for translation. Feeds Flashcarderator
projects.roles: UI/UX, Scripts, Some Rusty French, Cultural Curiosity
memories: Trying to read emails from an old friend in France and remembering that I spoke this language once
Wouldn't it be cool to export something for my Flashcarderator to use?
Thinking, while I'm at it, maybe I could also pick up some Greek, Lithuanian, Spanish and Italian
Why not go back to basics and do the whole thing in Vanilla JS, instead of Angular or React?

projects.name: SIFMA Stock Market Game Search
projects.what: Elastic search interface for a popular game that teaches kids how to use the stock market
memories: Being a key member of crack agile team that turned this out quickly
Collaborating with amazing PHP developers and Product Owner
Having fun making something borderline magical
Quickly learned Elastic Search to make it happen

projects.name: SIFMA Stock Market Game Registration
projects.what: Monster form wizard that registers kids and teachers for a popular classroom stock market game
memories: One of the most complicated things I’ve ever helped build
So many agile iterations... relationship with client
Collaborating with many talented teammates
Persistence paid off - pretty sweet form. Sign up and play!

projects.name: Caxy's Hungry Games
projects.what: ReactJS app that maps/reviews restaurants and bars where Caxy employees hung out
memories: Collaborating with a super-cool designer on UI/UX
Having fun making something that generated sale leads
Taking marketing group’s loose ideas and bringing em to life
Quickly learning ReactJS and ES2015 to make it happen

projects.name: Recipe Calculator - Server
status: Ask to sit down for a look
projects.what: Node/Express middleware for app I'm building to scale hotsauce recipes
projects.roles: Server-side JS, Database Chops, The Left Side of My Brain
memories: Needing data for an app I'm building to scale my hot-sauce habit
Filling backend knowledge gaps with egghead.io training
Revisiting database training from a past life
Knowing a bit more about what those backenders are up to during the day

projects.name: UI Prototype Template
projects.what: My personal lightweight template that I rolled for rapid UI/UX prototyping
projects.roles: Favorite Tools, Best Practices, Flexboxiness, Constructive Impatience
memories: Needing a quick-start for proofs of concept & test-driving tools
Realizing importance for sandboxing components prior to applying frameworks
... and prior to building out data models and APIs
Growing tired of shopping yeoman.io and configuring others' toolsets

projects.name: Trakan: Official Music Site
projects.what: Website to promote my music. 2018 version is in progress and has some cool particle animations
memories: First dive into handcoding an HTML5/CSS3 site with responsive grids
How far I’ve come building these things, looking back on the original site
Successful promotion of a record I wrote and produced (that I’m really proud of)
(I need to finish writing my new songs and finish the new/better version for 2018)

past.headline: Places Where I've Built Stuff In The Past
